Title: PEAR Net_Traceroute: Command injection
Synopsis:
An input sanitation error in PEAR Net_Traceroute might allow remote
    attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

Background.Text: PEAR Net_Traceroute is an OS independent wrapper class for executing traceroute calls from PHP.

Description.Text: Pasquale Imperato reported that the $host parameter to the traceroute() function in Traceroute.php is not properly sanitized before being passed to exec().

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability when user input is passed directly to PEAR Net_Traceroute in a PHP script, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary shell commands with the privileges of the user running the affected PHP script.

Workaround.Text: Ensure that all data that is passed to the traceroute() function is properly shell escaped (for instance using the escapeshellcmd() function).

P.Text: All PEAR Net_Traceroute users should upgrade to the latest version:
